setback.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were
setback.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The December elections were a major setback for the party.
The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
setback.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The team suffered a serious setback when the goalkeeper went off injured.
The islands’ economy had received a severe setback from the effects of hurricane Hugo.
Losing our key player would be a major setback for the team.
This is a serious setback to the company.
It was only a minor setback.
Try not to be discouraged by temporary setbacks.
The policy has been successful, despite some early setbacks.
The defeat represented a major political setback for the conservatives.
setback.translation[1].definitions[0].de: something that delays the progress or development of a plan, activity etc or makes things worse than they were before
setback.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The companysuffered a setback when it lost a bid to become the partner in a new venture.
After a series of setbacks things are beginning to look up for Britain’s second-largest bank.
